docs.lead_paragraph: The Economic Scene column this week has an analysis of how the federal government has run up trillion-dollar budget deficits. This post will explain the methodology.

headline.main: How We Crunched the Deficit Numbers

docs.abstract: Explaining the methodology behind the analysis of the federal budget in the Economic Scene column this week.
docs.snippet: Explaining the methodology behind the analysis of the federal budget in the Economic Scene column this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: A state-financed study of the health needs of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people in New York has found that they lack health insurance at rates higher than heterosexual people, fear homophobia by health care providers, and are more likely to experience depression, social isolation and inadequate housing than straight New Yorkers.

headline.main: Study Cites Health Disparities for Gays

docs.abstract: The study found that gays lack health insurance at rates higher than heterosexual people and fear homophobia by health care providers.
docs.snippet: The study found that gays lack health insurance at rates higher than heterosexual people and fear homophobia by health care providers.

headline.main: Health Care Reform, as the Insurers See It
headline.print_headline: Health Care Reform, as the Insurers See It

docs.lead_paragraph: Two 30-second commercials began running Friday on cable television stations in New Jersey as part of Gov. Jon S. Corzine’s general-election campaign against Christopher J. Christie, the Republican nominee.

headline.main: In Bid for Re-Election, New Jersey’s Governor Plays to Party Faithful
headline.print_headline: In Bid for Re-Election, New Jersey’s Governor Plays to Party Faithful

docs.snippet: Two 30-second commercials began running Friday on cable television stations in New Jersey as part of Gov. Jon S. Corzine’s general-election campaign against Christopher J. Christie, the Republican nominee.

docs.lead_paragraph: Members of Congress may rein in health spending by taking some Medicare money away from high-cost areas.

headline.print_headline: Spending Disparities Set Off a Fight in the Effort to Overhaul Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: In treatment for cancer, Senator Edward M. Kennedy is working on health legislation but is not at the Capitol.

headline.main: Senate Feels Ted Kennedy’s Absence on Health Bill

docs.lead_paragraph: This week's guest blogger, Francesco Bonami, was born in Florence and lives in New York. In 2003, he directed the Venice Biennale; next year, he'll curate the Whitney's. With Alison Gingeras, he staged the current show in Venice of the Pinault Collection. Bonami is also the artistic director of Fondazione Sandretto in Turin and of Fondazione Pitti Immagine Discovery in Florence. Read his previous post.
docs.abstract: VENICE -- It's the end of the the über art fest preview and now the mortals known as the public will come through the doors to be counted to establish if the Biennale was a success or a failure. Critical success and attendance does not go always hand in hand. In fact, two underground events rather than celebrity saturated ones had the better of the last day of the Biennale preview.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration plans to require banks and corporations that have received two rounds of federal bailouts to submit any major executive pay changes for approval by a new federal official who will monitor compensation, The New York Times's Louise Story and Eric Dash reported, citing two government officials.

headline.main: U.S. to Propose Wider Oversight of Compensation

docs.abstract: The Obama administration plans to require banks and corporations that have received two rounds of bailouts to submit any major executive pay changes for approval.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration plans to require banks and corporations that have received two rounds of bailouts to submit any major executive pay changes for approval.
